trans-unit.source: How to add operations to an API in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to add operations to an API in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add operations to an API in Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add operations to an API in Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: Before an API in API Management can be used, operations must be added.
trans-unit.target: Before an API in API Management can be used, operations must be added.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows how to add and configure different types of operations to an API in API Management.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows how to add and configure different types of operations to an API in API Management.

trans-unit.source: Operations are added and configured to an API in the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: Operations are added and configured to an API in the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: To access the publisher portal, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To access the publisher portal, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <linkText>Create an API Management service instance</linkText><title></title> in the <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <linkText>Create an API Management service instance</linkText><title></title> in the <linkText>Get started with Azure API Management</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Select the desired API in the API Management portal and then select the Operations tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired API in the API Management portal and then select the Operations tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Operations</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Operations</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Operation to add a new operation.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Operation to add a new operation.

trans-unit.source: The New operation will be displayed and the Signature tab will be selected by default.
trans-unit.target: The New operation will be displayed and the Signature tab will be selected by default.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add operation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add operation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Specify the HTTP verb by choosing from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Specify the HTTP verb by choosing from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HTTP method</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HTTP method</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Define the URL template by typing in a URL fragment consisting of one or more URL path segments and zero or more query string parameters.
trans-unit.target: Define the URL template by typing in a URL fragment consisting of one or more URL path segments and zero or more query string parameters.

trans-unit.source: The URL template, appended to the base URL of the API, identifies a single HTTP operation.
trans-unit.target: The URL template, appended to the base URL of the API, identifies a single HTTP operation.

trans-unit.source: It may contain one or more named variable parts that are identified by curly braces.
trans-unit.target: It may contain one or more named variable parts that are identified by curly braces.

trans-unit.source: These variable parts are called template parameters and are dynamically assigned values extracted from the request's URL when the request is being processed by the API Management platform.
trans-unit.target: These variable parts are called template parameters and are dynamically assigned values extracted from the request's URL when the request is being processed by the API Management platform.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>URL template</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>URL template</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If desired, specify the Rewrite URL template.
trans-unit.target: If desired, specify the Rewrite URL template.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to use the standard URL template for processing incoming requests on the front-end, while calling the back-end via a converted URL according to the rewrite template.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to use the standard URL template for processing incoming requests on the front-end, while calling the back-end via a converted URL according to the rewrite template.

trans-unit.source: Template parameters from the URL template should be used in the rewrite template.
trans-unit.target: Template parameters from the URL template should be used in the rewrite template.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how content type encoded as path segment in the web service from the previous example can be provided as a query parameter in the API published via the API Management platform using the URL templates.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how content type encoded as path segment in the web service from the previous example can be provided as a query parameter in the API published via the API Management platform using the URL templates.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>URL template rewrite</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>URL template rewrite</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Callers to the operation will use the format /customers?customerid=ALFKI and this will be mapped to /Customers('ALFKI') when the back-end service is invoked.
trans-unit.target: Callers to the operation will use the format /customers?customerid=ALFKI and this will be mapped to /Customers('ALFKI') when the back-end service is invoked.

trans-unit.source: Display name and Description provide a description of the operation and are used to provide documentation to the developers using this API in the developer portal.
trans-unit.target: Display name and Description provide a description of the operation and are used to provide documentation to the developers using this API in the developer portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Description</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Description</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The operation description can be specified as plain text or HTML in the Description text box.
trans-unit.target: The operation description can be specified as plain text or HTML in the Description text box.

trans-unit.source: Response caching reduces latency perceived by the API consumers, lowers bandwidth consumption and decreases the load on the HTTP web service implementing the API.
trans-unit.target: Response caching reduces latency perceived by the API consumers, lowers bandwidth consumption and decreases the load on the HTTP web service implementing the API.

trans-unit.source: To easily and quickly enable caching for the operation, select the Caching tab and check the Enable checkbox.
trans-unit.target: To easily and quickly enable caching for the operation, select the Caching tab and check the Enable checkbox.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Caching</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Caching</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Duration specifies the time period during which the operation response remains in the cache.
trans-unit.target: Duration specifies the time period during which the operation response remains in the cache.

trans-unit.source: The default value is 3600 seconds or 1 hour.
trans-unit.target: The default value is 3600 seconds or 1 hour.

trans-unit.source: Cache keys are used to differentiate between responses so that the response corresponding to each different cache key will get its own separate cached value.
trans-unit.target: Cache keys are used to differentiate between responses so that the response corresponding to each different cache key will get its own separate cached value.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, enter specific query string parameters and/or HTTP headers to be used in computing cache key values in the Vary by query string parameters and Vary by headers text boxes respectively.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, enter specific query string parameters and/or HTTP headers to be used in computing cache key values in the Vary by query string parameters and Vary by headers text boxes respectively.

trans-unit.source: When none are specified, full request URL and the following HTTP header values are used in cache key generation: Accept and Accept-Charset.
trans-unit.target: When none are specified, full request URL and the following HTTP header values are used in cache key generation: Accept and Accept-Charset.

trans-unit.source: For more information on caching and caching policies, see <linkText>How to cache operation results in Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on caching and caching policies, see <linkText>How to cache operation results in Azure API Management</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Operation parameters are managed on the Parameters tab.
trans-unit.target: Operation parameters are managed on the Parameters tab.

trans-unit.source: Parameters specified in the URL Template on the Signature tab are added automatically and can be changed only by editing the URL template.
trans-unit.target: Parameters specified in the URL Template on the Signature tab are added automatically and can be changed only by editing the URL template.

trans-unit.source: Additional parameters can be entered manually.
trans-unit.target: Additional parameters can be entered manually.

trans-unit.source: To add a new query parameter, click Add Query Parameter and enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: To add a new query parameter, click Add Query Parameter and enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: Name - parameter name.
trans-unit.target: Name - parameter name.

trans-unit.source: Description - a brief description of the parameter (optional).
trans-unit.target: Description - a brief description of the parameter (optional).

trans-unit.source: Type - parameter type, selected in the drop down.
trans-unit.target: Type - parameter type, selected in the drop down.

trans-unit.source: Values - values that can be assigned to this parameter.
trans-unit.target: Values - values that can be assigned to this parameter.

trans-unit.source: One of the values can be marked as default (optional).
trans-unit.target: One of the values can be marked as default (optional).

trans-unit.source: Required - make the parameter mandatory by checking the checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Required - make the parameter mandatory by checking the checkbox.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Request parameters</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Request parameters</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If the operation allows (e.g. PUT, POST) and requires a body you may provide an example of it in all of the supported representation formats (e.g. json, XML).
trans-unit.target: If the operation allows (e.g. PUT, POST) and requires a body you may provide an example of it in all of the supported representation formats (e.g. json, XML).

trans-unit.source: The request body is used for documentation purposes only and is not validated.
trans-unit.target: The request body is used for documentation purposes only and is not validated.

trans-unit.source: To enter a request body, switch to the Body tab.
trans-unit.target: To enter a request body, switch to the Body tab.

trans-unit.source: Click Add Representation, start typing desired content type name (e.g. application/json), select it in the drop-down, and paste the desired request body example in the selected format into the text box.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Representation, start typing desired content type name (e.g. application/json), select it in the drop-down, and paste the desired request body example in the selected format into the text box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Request body</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Request body</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In additional to representations, you can also specify an optional text description in the Description text box.
trans-unit.target: In additional to representations, you can also specify an optional text description in the Description text box.

trans-unit.source: It is a good practice to provide examples of responses for all status codes that the operation may produce.
trans-unit.target: It is a good practice to provide examples of responses for all status codes that the operation may produce.

trans-unit.source: Each status code may have more than one response body example, one for each of the supported content types.
trans-unit.target: Each status code may have more than one response body example, one for each of the supported content types.

trans-unit.source: To add a response, click Add and start typing the desired status code.
trans-unit.target: To add a response, click Add and start typing the desired status code.

trans-unit.source: In this example the status code is 200 OK.
trans-unit.target: In this example the status code is 200 OK.

trans-unit.source: Once the code is displayed in the drop-down, select it, and the response code is created and added to your operation.
trans-unit.target: Once the code is displayed in the drop-down, select it, and the response code is created and added to your operation.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Response code</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Response code</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Representation, start typing the desired content type name (e.g. application/json) and then select it in the drop down.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Representation, start typing the desired content type name (e.g. application/json) and then select it in the drop down.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Body content type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Body content type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Paste the response body example in the selected format into the text box.
trans-unit.target: Paste the response body example in the selected format into the text box.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Response body</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Response body</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If desired, add an optional description into the Description text box.
trans-unit.target: If desired, add an optional description into the Description text box.

trans-unit.source: Once the operation is configured, click Save.
trans-unit.target: Once the operation is configured, click Save.

trans-unit.source: Once the operations are added to an API, the next step is to associate the API with a product and publish it so that developers can call its operations.
trans-unit.target: Once the operations are added to an API, the next step is to associate the API with a product and publish it so that developers can call its operations.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>How to create and publish a product</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>How to create and publish a product</linkText><title></title>
